message.content:
There are several factors that can influence the cost of building a mobile app, including:

1. Functionality and features: The more complex the app, with more features and functionalities, the higher the cost.

2. Platform: Developing an app for multiple platforms (iOS, Android) will increase costs as it requires additional coding and resources.

3. Design complexity: A basic design may be cheaper to develop than a highly-customized design with unique elements or complicated graphics.

4. Development team location: Hiring developers from different countries can affect rates due to differences in wages and living standards.

5. Outsourcing versus in-house development: Building an app with an internal team might require hiring new employees, while outsourcing could lead to lower labor costs but less control over project management.

6. Maintenance & updates: Regular maintenance expenses will raise overall costs; these include bug fixes or software upgrades needed after launch due to evolving technology trends or user needs changes since initial deployment.
